column5: Hi guys, I found this one hanging not connected to anything.  Can anyone point me to where it should connect to?    it's right by the oil dipstick on a yamaha 40hp 4-stroke
Breather hose?You can't find any where within that length to where it may go?
no i cannot unless it is underneath / behind the manifold?? directly above?

Open the brass screw 1/2 turn it should let fuel flow out if it is what I think it is. If it does it is the bleed down for the carb. If no fuel then re close the screw 1/2 turn and I have guessed wrong.   Art
Art this is a fuel inject motor.  Tho that doesnt mean you are wrong.  If I do turn it and fuel comes out what do I do with it
Looks like a fuel drain line to me
well, I will feel silly (but relieved) if that's what it is.  i'll give the screw a quick turn tomorrow and if i get fuel coming out i guess it is safe to assume it's the drain
Possibly in place to drain ethanol gas before it does more harm.
Yes it also applies to fuel Injected motors  I am used to working on the carb. engines because it is what I own. Same principle though.     Art
It's not disconnected, mine has the same.
